channel.title: Getting a remote ip
channel.description: What is the best way to get a remote ip without the person knowing? Me and a friend are messing with this prank program, and have hidden it in a ventrilo install, but we dont know a way to get the persons port yet, not using it for anyhting bad, just trying to mess with a friend of ours.

item.title: Getting a remote ip
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

^ That and if the file transfer ports are blocked at either end it’ll (very slowly) go through the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting a remote ip
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

To get an IP from a file transfer in msn messenger the file needs to be at least 1024kb (but it might have changed with the newer protocol).

Read full topic

item.title: Getting a remote ip
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

at ^, only if it is direct connected, other wise you would get like the aim server ip or w/e, and i want to be more automated,

and on taht, Didn’t think of php, i will just have it send him to a web page when he runs the installer and that web page will store his ip in my mysql database and redirect him to the official site for vent or something. Now i just need to learn what is crashing everything on my pc =/

Read full topic

item.title: Getting a remote ip
item.dc:creator: @reVein reVein
item.description:
@reVein wrote:

Just opening a chat conversation with them and doing netstat -n would show their ip, now wouldn’t it?

Read full topic

item.title: Getting a remote ip
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

engage him in DCC over IRC, and sniff the packets

i dont remember, but i think you can use msn somehow as well,
maybe send him a file or something (and sniff the packets)

also, you might not get his ip, you might get the ip of his router or something,

Read full topic

item.title: Getting a remote ip
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Assuming you have access to a PHP enabled webserver, use this:

<?php
$ip = $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'];
mail( "YOUR-EMAIL-HERE@SOME.TLD", "SUBJECT LINE, "Visited IP was: " . $ip , "From: ANY-EMAIL-HERE@SOME.TLD" );
echo ("404 not found");
?>

Obviously, replace the two emails (first one is to whom you are sending it, should be your email address, second one can be whatever), and that should be it. You can change the subject line as well, if so inclined.

Just have them visit that page, it will echo out to the user “404 not found”, but it has really behind-the-scenes emailed you their IP address.

For social-engineering purposes, change the text of [tt]echo (“404 not found”);[/tt] to [tt]echo (“Why did the chicken cross the road? To get to the other side!”);[/tt] and name the file something like epicJoke.php, and call him up and tell him to visit that page for “the best joke ever”.

[hr]

Alternatively, if you don’t have access to a PHP enabled webserver, or are unable to get your friend to go to the page, you can always, if possible, go over to their house and, once on their computer, go to whatismyip.com, and then proceed to write it down.

Read full topic
